page.title: 08PRISTON VILLAGE
page.content: Priston (mentioned in the 1086 Domesday book) consists of 65 houses, 3 farms (Village, Pressbarrow and Church), a sewage works, a church, a garage, the Ring of Bells public house and the village hall (a former school) 1/3 of the houses have either been built during the last 25 years or are converted farm/mine workers cottages. Only one more house can be built but further conversion of present cottages or barns can take place. Approximately 240 people live in Priston. 20 are aged between 4 and 16 years and 12 are over 60. The oldest is 92. There is little unemployment. Several people are self-employed with only two people employed in the village (on a farm). The majority of the inhabitants work in nearby towns and cities.
